newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore trade in shortcovering, Goodyear eyed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore trade in shortcovering, Goodyear eyed.

text.p: Trading in the Singapore rubber market was dominated on Wednesday by shortcovering for RSS3 and RSS1 grade rubber while the business kept a wary eye on the strike in Goodyear Tire, dealers said.

"There was some shortcovering by European buyers for RSS1 and RSS3, but other people are still very careful because of the Goodyear strike," a trader said. Some deals were also concluded for forward shipments of TSR20 rubber.

Dealers said the trade was watching for any sign that Goodyear, whose annual consumption of rubber reaches about 300,000 tonnes, may defer some shipments because of the strike. "I heard from New York they will begin defering shipments of 2,000 tonnes although there were no details," one said.
Traders said major consumers in the Singapore rubber trade were not seen in the market. "I don't think I've seen the majors doing anything today," one trader said.
Offer prices for SIR20 rubber are tipped to dip further to 45 U.S. cents a lb after being quoted around 46-47 cents this morning largely because of Goodyear's strike, dealers said.
